references.paper_title: Deep residual learning for image recognition
references.reason: This paper introduces the ResNet architecture, a crucial component in many of the deep learning models used in the experiments for semi-supervised learning.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, presented in this paper, is used for feature extraction in the experiments, significantly impacting the performance and efficiency of sample selection.

references.paper_title: Fixmatch: Simplifying semi-supervised learning with consistency and confidence
references.reason: FixMatch is one of the two state-of-the-art SSL frameworks used in the experiments, representing a major approach in semi-supervised learning and directly influencing the results.

references.paper_title: Freematch: Self-adaptive thresholding for semi-supervised learning
references.reason: FreeMatch, another state-of-the-art SSL framework, provides a baseline for comparison and highlights the effectiveness of the proposed sample selection method in enhancing SSL performance.

references.paper_title: Active learning for convolutional neural networks: A core-set approach
references.reason: CoreSet, a prominent method in active learning, serves as a primary comparison point and helps demonstrate the advantages of the proposed RDSS approach over existing sample selection techniques.
